intro: Braunsia apiculata, commonly known as the woolly bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Braunsia apiculata is also noted for its ability to tolerate coastal conditions and salty air.
